html:
Tornadoes and severe weather wreaked major damage in multiple states late Friday, tearing through a candle factory in Kentucky, an Amazon facility in Illinois, a nursing home in Arkansas and numerous homes and buildings

A new government report showing inflation rising at the fastest rate in nearly four decades is raising fresh questions about the fate of President Joe Biden's social and environment legislation

Health experts still don't know if the omicron variant is causing milder COVID-19, but more indicators are emerging from South Africa

Top diplomats from the Group of Seven industrialized nations are gathering in Liverpool, England, for a meeting that host country Britain calls "a show of unity against global aggressors."

Simply counting up the human cost of the horrifying truck crash that killed 55 migrants and injured over 100 is chilling, even for those who survived the disaster on a highway in southern Mexico

Health officials say Taiwan has recorded its first case of the omicron variant in a passenger who recently traveled to the southern African country of Eswatini

Bob Dole has returned to Kansas for memorials in his hometown and at the Statehouse

Voters in the South Pacific archipelago of New Caledonia are set to decide Sunday whether to break away from France

A Cuban couple and their daughter have resettled in a small Serbian town after fleeing Cuba five years ago

Tens of thousands of Indian farmers are clearing protest sites along the capital's fringes and returning home, marking an end to yearlong demonstrations against controversial farm laws
